📘 參考詳解

(a)
P 代表受質。
P represents the substrate.

因為兩個 P 分子在酶 R 的協助下可結合生成一個 Q 分子。
Because two P molecules are joined together with the help of enzyme R to form one Q molecule.

這個反應屬於合成代謝反應，所以 P 是受質。
This reaction is an example of an anabolic (synthetic) reaction, so P is the substrate.

(b)
R 代表酶。
R represents the enzyme.

它具有特定形狀的活性部位，可與 P 或 Q 結合。
It has a specific shape or an active site for binding with P or Q.

在整個反應過程中，R 的形狀沒有改變，顯示它作為催化劑而不被消耗。
During the whole reaction, the shape of R remains unchanged, indicating that it acts as a catalyst and is not consumed.

因此，R 是酶，能與受質形成酶–受質複合物。
Therefore, R is the enzyme that forms an enzyme–substrate complex with the substrate.

⚠️ 考試提醒（Exam Tips）
答題關鍵詞要包括：
「active site／活性部位」、
「specific shape／特定形狀」、
「enzyme–substrate complex／酶–受質複合物」、
「unchanged after reaction／反應後形狀不變」。

常見失分點：

忘記提到酶在反應後不被改變。
僅寫「P 是受質」或「R 是酶」而沒有解釋原因。
建議句式（雙語模板）

「P 是受質，因為它在反應中被酶幫助結合產生新化合物。」
→ P is the substrate because it is joined together with the help of an enzyme to form a product.

「R 是酶，因為它有特定的活性位與受質結合，並在反應後保持不變。」
→ R is the enzyme because it has a specific active site for binding with the substrate and remains unchanged after the reaction.
